column4: hi all. quick question. can heavy disk i/o cause a system freeze or is it more likely a faulty hard drive?
well, were you doing something that produced a great deal of disk i/o?
heh heh, yeah if you're encoding and writing on a single disk, you might have some i/o waiting going on :-)
generally not, but how long did you leave the system running? are you sure it was locked?

sorry i didn't see your response to my question. i've left the system on for a few hours and everything stays frozen. can't ping from another machine. mouse doesn't move. keyboard is unresponsive etc. it's most definitely locked up.
hmm. anything deposited in the system logs before the thing dies?
but other than that no errors that tell me anything. the drive is formatted as jfs and is separate from the operating system.
what precisely is the machine doing when it dies? or is it random?
it is recording 4 video streams and running a mencoder process
how much memory is this machine packing?
1gb ram, 2gb swap, the hd i am recording to is 200gb
how long does it take the machine to crash under this load? also, does it respond to "alt-sysrq" commands?
i've run top while testing the machine and when it locks up i don't see significant swap or cpu usage
i can run 4 recordings simultatneously, but as soon as i start the mencoder process, it locks up.
does the machine spend a lot of time in i/o wait? (the "wa" index in top)
i did not know about that. i will have to look next time i can test it.  what is "alt-sysrq"?

unfortunately, i have to be going. i would say that you might try a smaller number of streams, and see if the problem persists. the computer may simply be trying unsuccessfully t o deal with the load. best of luck sorting things out!
